moves.9... O-O: Qc3 would win a piece here
moves.10. e4: I didn't see it... (and make a poor move!)
moves.10... cxd4: He relocates my knight and I am oblivious to the intent
moves.11. Nxd4 Ng4: sadly, I still don't see the threat
moves.12. Qc6: now I notice I could win a piece, but it's too late
moves.12... Bxh2+: I now see that I'm in trouble, but it's too late
moves.13... Qh4 14. g3: the only way to delay mate I could think of...
moves.14... Bxg3+: Kg2 is forced... (Kg1 is followed by Qh2 mate)
moves.15. Kg2: f3 is my only escape route
moves.17... Nxc6 18. Nf3: try to get the queen to give my king some breathing room...
moves.18... Qg2: she doesn't want to go far
moves.19. Be3: adding protection to the weak pawn ad linking the rooks
moves.19... Nxe3: well, I guess he's ready to start swapping pieces now (he is a Q up)
moves.20. Kxe3 d4+:
taking the pawn has serious consequences (Bxf2  and the knight is lost too
)
moves.22. bxc3 e5 23. Ke1: removes the pin on my pawn
moves.24. Rxf2 Qg3 25. Ke2: my king must protect several pieces
moves.25... Bg4 26. Raf1: hopefully, doubling the rooks will releive some pressure
moves.26... Rae8 27. Kd2 Na5: a sneaky knight tries to slip in
moves.28. Kc2: I don't want the knight getting thru to b3
moves.28... f5: he wants his rooks in on the battle
moves.29. exf5: the alternative didn't look any better
moves.31. Nd2 Re3: all is lost now... it's just a matter of time
moves.33. Rf2f4 Rxc3+ 34. Kb1: maybe I can for the rook and queen on my next move?
moves.35. Rf1f2 Qd3+: with only two or three moves left, I decide to resign
